title: Turkestan
subtitle: The Spiritual Capital & Yasawi Mausoleum
description: Turkestan is one of Kazakhstan's most historic cities, with an archaeological record dating back to the 4th century. It was a major trade center on the Silk Road and is now the spiritual capital of the Turkic world. The centerpiece is the Mausoleum of Khoja Ahmed Yasawi, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

title: Shymkent
subtitle: City Vibes: Citadel & Old Town
description: Shymkent is a vibrant metropolis with a warm southern soul. It blends ancient history with modern energy. From the bustling bazaars to the ancient citadel, Shymkent offers a unique experience of Kazakh hospitality and culture.

title: Ancient Otrar
subtitle: Arystan Bab Mausoleum & Ruins
description: Otrar was a ghost town with a history of 2,000 years. It was a major center of trade and craft on the Silk Road. Today, the ruins of Otrar tell the story of the Mongol invasion and the resilience of the people.

title: Akmeshit Cave
subtitle: Nature's Underground Wonder
description: Akmeshit Cave is a unique natural monument. It is a huge hollow with its own microclimate, where trees grow inside. Legend has it that women and children hid here during the Dzungar invasion.

title: Dendropark
subtitle: Green Oasis in Shymkent
description: The Shymkent Dendropark is a massive arboretum showcasing a diverse collection of flora. It's a perfect place for a relaxing walk, a boat ride on the lake, or simply enjoying the fresh air.

title: Sayram
subtitle: The City of Countless Mausoleums
description: Sayram is one of the oldest settlements in Kazakhstan, dating back over 3,000 years. It is known as the birthplace of Khoja Ahmed Yasawi and is dotted with numerous mausoleums of Islamic scholars and saints.

title: Ancient Citadel
subtitle: Heart of Old Shymkent
description: The Ancient Citadel of Shymkent is an archaeological park located in the heart of the modern city. It reveals the layers of history from the Kangju period to the 19th century.
